title: Kisan Ittehad hails PM’s initiative of agri-tubwells’ solarization
content:
QUETTA, Jul 10 (APP): Chairman of Kisan Ittehad, Khalid Hussain Bath on Wednesday lauded Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif’s initiative of converting 28,000 tube wells to solar panels in Balochistan.
Addressing a press conference here at Quetta Press Club, he said shifting of tube wells to solar energy will pave the way for Balochistan’s development and prosperity.
“Balochistan has fertile land and making agricultural lands cultivable can increase the country’s resources,” he said, urging that the province has around 40,000 tube wells, and an additional 16,000 tube wells should also be converted to solar energy.
The Chairman Kisan Ittehad thanked Chief Minister of Balochistan Sarfraz Bugti and the Prime Minister of Pakistan for their orders to convert thousands of tube wells to solar power.
He requested Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Chief Minister Balochistan to take measures to promote tourism in the province, ensuring the security of tourist areas to increase the province’s resources.
He noted that last year’s heavy rains caused significant damage to farmers, and stressed the need that the government should immediately compensate for their losses.
He also called for taking precautionary measures to deal with the upcoming rains in order to minimize the losses to landowners.
